name: market for packaging, for fertilisers | packaging, for fertilisers | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20856/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This dataset is a market dataset for packaging, for fertilisers, which accounts for the delivery (transportation expenditures) of the packaging to the datasets consuming it. ;The reference product refers to the amount of fertiliser packed, not the amount of packaging material.;Default transportation values are used for plastic products from their production site to the site where they are filled with fertilisers. Default transportation values are used for fertilisers from the site where the packaging is filled with fertilisers till the farm that are finally used.

The activity starts right after the production of the packaging, for fertilisers.

The activity ends with the provision of the packaging, for fertilisers, to its users.
category: C:Manufacturing/22:Manufacture of rubber and plastics products/222:Manufacture of plastics products/2220:Manufacture of plastics products

flow.name: packaging, for fertilisers
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/22:Manufacture of rubber and plastics products/222:Manufacture of plastics products/2220:Manufacture of plastics products

exchanges.description:
This transportation distance accounts for the transportation necessary for plastic products (material of packaging) and the transportation that takes place from the fertiliser production plant until the farm that is used. Transport distance calculated using default transportation assumptions that are available at: https://www.ecoinvent.org/home.html.
This transport distance is multiplied with the amount of plastic for packaging
